summary: The bill, titled the CDFI Bond Guarantee Program Improvement Act of 2025, aims to amend the Community Development Banking and Financial Institutions Act of 1994. It focuses on reauthorizing and improving the community development financial institutions (CDFI) bond guarantee program. Key changes include removing a calculation related to bond guarantees, setting a minimum guarantee amount of $25 million with an annual total limit of $1 billion, and extending the program's authorization period. Additionally, the bill mandates a Treasury Department report on the program's effectiveness.
